author: BBC News
description:
Ukraine says a "common understanding" has been reached with the US on  a peace deal aimed at ending the war with Russia.

The proposal is based on a 28-point plan presented to Ukraine by the US last week.

In a post on social media, US President Donald Trump said the original plan had been fine-tuned and “a deal may be close”.   He’s sending his special envoy Steve Witkoff to Moscow discuss the plan with Russia’s President Putin.

The Kremlin said earlier that Russia had not yet been consulted on the new draft deal and warned that it might not accept amendments to the original plan.

Some of the key issues which divide Russia and Ukraine are reported to remain unaddressed so far – including security guarantees for Ukraine and control of several regions in the east of the country.

European leaders have expressed scepticism that peace could be in reach.  The French President Emmanuel Macron said he saw "no Russian will for a ceasefire" while the UK warned there was still “a long way to
title: Ukraine reaches “understanding” with US on peace plan as Trump says “deal may be close” | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Is the current AI boom a bubble or just the beginning of a technological revolution?
 
On AI Decoded, Google CEO Sundar Pichai warns that every company would be impacted if the AI boom were to go bust.
 
Also on the show, Financial Times AI Editor Madhumita Murgia, who shares insights from her recent conversation with Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang, who believes fears of a crash are overblown.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#AI #Nvidia #BBCNews
title: Will the AI Boom Go Bust? | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
With rumours circulating about the budget, what are the changes that could impact you?

On the eve of the budget it has confirmed that more drinks will be included in the so called “sugar tax” and there will be an increase in the minimum + living wage. But what other changes could happen?

Will there be changes to the way you can save into an ISA? Could a “tourist tax” be introduced in some cities? And, will there be changes to council tax?

Adam and Chris are joined by Claer Barrett, consumer editor at the FT.

You can now listen to Newscast on a smart speaker. If you want to listen, just say "Ask BBC Sounds to play Newscast”. It works on most smart speakers.

You can join our Newscast online community here: https://bbc.in/newscastdiscord

Get in touch with Newscast by emailing newscast@bbc.co.uk or send us a WhatsApp on +44 0330 123 9480.

New episodes released every day. If you're in the UK, for more News and Current Affairs podcasts from the BBC, listen on BBC Sounds: https://bbc.
title: What taxes could rise in the budget? | BBC Newscast

author: BBC News
title: Pope Francis' Popemobile has been transformed into a health clinic for children in Gaza. #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
Dozens of high engagement accounts on the social media platform X have been accused of misleading users following the rollout of a new transparency feature that shows user locations.

BBC Verify has found accounts posing as US and Scottish users getting involved in national political debates, which actually seem to be run by people in other countries such as Kenya and Iran.

The BBC’s Shayan Sardarizadeh and Thomas Copeland have been telling the Global News Podcast about the story.  

Subscribe to the Global News Podcast wherever you get your podcasts or find more episodes here: https://bbc.in/GlobalNewsPodcast

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: X's new location feature exposes misleading politics accounts | Global News Podcast

author: BBC News
description:
The brain goes through five distinct phases in life, with key turning points at ages nine, 32, 66 and 83, scientists have revealed.
 
Around 4,000 people up to the age of 90 had scans to reveal the connections between their brain cells.
 
Researchers at the University of Cambridge showed that the brain stays in the adolescent phase until our early thirties when we "peak".
 
They say the results could help us understand why the risk of mental health disorders and dementia varies through life.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#MentalHealth #Science #BBCNews
title: Adolescence lasts into 30s, new study shows | BBC News

author: BBC News
title: Nigel Farage responded to allegations he made racist and antisemitic remarks in school. #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
China has launched a spacecraft to allow them to bring back three astronauts, stuck in the country's space station, back to earth. 
 
The unmanned Shenzhou-22 was not supposed to be launched until April next year.
 
But the crew on the space station currently have no way of returning home if there was an emergency because an earlier launch vehicle was declared unfit to fly after its window was cracked by suspected space debris.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#China #Space #BBCNews
title: China launches spaceship to bring stuck astronauts back home | BBC News

author: BBC News
title: Morgan Geyser, the 'Slender Man' stabber, captured after fleeing custody. #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer has said "matters about Ukraine and it's future must be determined by Ukraine".
 
He also told MPs that Britain will "never faulter" in its support for the country ahead of Tuesday's virtual  "coalition of the willing" meeting of Ukraine's European allies.
 
Earlier in the day, President Volodymyr Zelensky said he had a "good and very productive" conversation with Starmer, in which they discussed the agenda for the meeting.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Ukraine #UK #BBCNews
title: UK PM Keir Starmer says 'long way to go' in Ukraine peace talks | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Activists have accused Nigerian authorities of ignoring a kidnapping crisis and have called for the rescue of students abducted in the north last week.
 
The Christian Association of Nigeria said more than 300 children were kidnapped when gunman stormed a Catholic boarding school on Friday.
 
Fifty of those children have escaped and have been reunited with their families, according to the association. However, the police said they haven't been able to confirm these reports.
 
A rescue operation is under way for the 253 children and 12 teachers who remain missing. 
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#Nigeria #Africa #BBCNews
title: Nigerian government under pressure over kidnapping crisis | BBC News

title: Meet the lucky turkeys being pardoned by President Trump before Thanksgiving. #Thanksgiving #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
Six people have been killed in Russian strikes on Kyiv overnight, the city's mayor has said. 
 
Meanwhile, Russia said three people have been killed by Ukrainian strikes.
 
It comes as the US confirmed American officials were set to meet Russian representatives in Abu Dhabi as part of efforts to end the war.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#Ukraine #Russia #BBCNews
title: Russia and Ukraine trade deadly strikes as US and Moscow hold talks | BBC News

title: First Lady Melania Trump welcomes the White House Christmas tree. #US #Christmas #BBCNews
